channel.title: CVE Feed for PostgreSQL -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for PostgreSQL -- all products

item.title: CVE-2019-10210|2024-08-04T22:17:19.604Z -- postgresql -- postgresql
item.description: Postgresql Windows installer before versions 11.5, 10.10, 9.6.15, 9.5.19, 9.4.24 is vulnerable via superuser writing password to unprotected temporary file.

item.title: CVE-2019-10211|2024-08-04T22:17:18.944Z -- postgresql -- postgresql
item.description: Postgresql Windows installer before versions 11.5, 10.10, 9.6.15, 9.5.19, 9.4.24 is vulnerable via bundled OpenSSL executing code from unprotected directory.

item.title: CVE-2019-10208|2024-08-04T22:17:18.925Z -- postgresql -- postgresql
item.description: A flaw was discovered in postgresql versions 9.4.x before 9.4.24, 9.5.x before 9.5.19, 9.6.x before 9.6.15, 10.x before 10.10 and 11.x before 11.5 where arbitrary SQL statements can be executed given a suitable SECURITY DEFINER function. An attacker, with EXECUTE permission on the function, can execute arbitrary SQL as the owner of the function.

item.title: CVE-2019-10209|2024-08-04T22:17:20.096Z -- postgresql -- postgresql
item.description: Postgresql, versions 11.x before 11.5, is vulnerable to a memory disclosure in cross-type comparison for hashed subplan.

item.title: CVE-2019-10164|2024-08-04T22:10:10.043Z -- postgresql -- postgresql
item.description: PostgreSQL versions 10.x before 10.9 and versions 11.x before 11.4 are vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow. Any authenticated user can overflow a stack-based buffer by changing the user's own password to a purpose-crafted value. This often suffices to execute arbitrary code as the PostgreSQL operating system account.
